trans-unit.source: Provision the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Configure and create a Data Science Virtual Machine on Azure to do analytics and machine learning.
trans-unit.target: Configure and create a Data Science Virtual Machine on Azure to do analytics and machine learning.

trans-unit.source: Provision the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Provision the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine is an Azure virtual machine (VM) image pre-installed and configured with several popular tools that are commonly used for data analytics and machine learning.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine is an Azure virtual machine (VM) image pre-installed and configured with several popular tools that are commonly used for data analytics and machine learning.

trans-unit.source: The tools included are:
trans-unit.target: The tools included are:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft R Server Developer Edition
trans-unit.target: Microsoft R Server Developer Edition

trans-unit.source: Anaconda Python distribution
trans-unit.target: Anaconda Python distribution

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Community Edition
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Community Edition

trans-unit.source: Power BI desktop
trans-unit.target: Power BI desktop

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Express edition
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Express edition

trans-unit.source: Azure SDK
trans-unit.target: Azure SDK

trans-unit.source: Doing data science involves iterating on a sequence of tasks: finding, loading, and pre-processing data, building and testing models, and deploying the models for consumption in intelligent applications.
trans-unit.target: Doing data science involves iterating on a sequence of tasks: finding, loading, and pre-processing data, building and testing models, and deploying the models for consumption in intelligent applications.

trans-unit.source: It is not uncommon for data scientists to use a variety of tools to to complete these tasks.
trans-unit.target: It is not uncommon for data scientists to use a variety of tools to to complete these tasks.

trans-unit.source: It can be quite time consuming to find the appropriate versions of the software, and then download and install them.
trans-unit.target: It can be quite time consuming to find the appropriate versions of the software, and then download and install them.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine can ease this burden.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine can ease this burden.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine jump starts your analytics project.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine jump starts your analytics project.

trans-unit.source: It enables you to work on tasks in a variety of languages including R, Python, SQL, and C#.
trans-unit.target: It enables you to work on tasks in a variety of languages including R, Python, SQL, and C#.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio provides an IDE to develop and test your code that is easy to use.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio provides an IDE to develop and test your code that is easy to use.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SDK included in the VM allows you to build your applications using various services on Microsoft’s cloud platform.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SDK included in the VM allows you to build your applications using various services on Microsoft’s cloud platform.

trans-unit.source: There is no software charges for this data science VM image.
trans-unit.target: There is no software charges for this data science VM image.

trans-unit.source: You only pay for the Azure usage fees which is dependent on the size of the virtual machine you will be provisioning with this VM image.
trans-unit.target: You only pay for the Azure usage fees which is dependent on the size of the virtual machine you will be provisioning with this VM image.

trans-unit.source: More details on the compute fees can be found [here] (https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/partners/microsoft-ads/standard-data-science-vm/).
trans-unit.target: More details on the compute fees can be found [here] (https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/partners/microsoft-ads/standard-data-science-vm/).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you can create a Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you can create a Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**: To obtain one, see [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**: To obtain one, see [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **An Azure storage account**: To create one, see [Create an Azure storage account](storage-create-storage-account.md#create-a-storage-account) Alternatively, the storage account can be created as part of the process of creating the VM if you do not want to use an existing account.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure storage account**: To create one, see [Create an Azure storage account](storage-create-storage-account.md#create-a-storage-account) Alternatively, the storage account can be created as part of the process of creating the VM if you do not want to use an existing account.

trans-unit.source: Create your Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Create your Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Here are the steps to create an instance of the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: Here are the steps to create an instance of the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the virtual machine listing on [Azure Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft-ads.standard-data-science-vmstandard-data-science-vm).
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the virtual machine listing on [Azure Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/#create/microsoft-ads.standard-data-science-vmstandard-data-science-vm).

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Create** button at the bottom to be taken into a wizard.![configure-data-science-vm](./media/machine-learning-data-science-provision-vm/configure-data-science-virtual-machine.png)
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Create** button at the bottom to be taken into a wizard.![configure-data-science-vm](./media/machine-learning-data-science-provision-vm/configure-data-science-virtual-machine.png)

trans-unit.source: The following sections provide the **inputs** for each of the **5 steps** (enumerated on the right of the figure above) in the wizard used to create the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The following sections provide the **inputs** for each of the **5 steps** (enumerated on the right of the figure above) in the wizard used to create the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Here are the inputs needed to configure each of these steps:
trans-unit.target: Here are the inputs needed to configure each of these steps:

trans-unit.source: **a. Basics**:
trans-unit.target: **a. Basics**:

trans-unit.source: **Name**: Name of your data science server you are creating.
trans-unit.target: **Name**: Name of your data science server you are creating.

trans-unit.source: **User Name**: Admin account login id
trans-unit.target: **User Name**: Admin account login id

trans-unit.source: **Password**: Admin account password
trans-unit.target: **Password**: Admin account password

trans-unit.source: **Subscription**: If you have more than one subscription, select the one on which the machine will be created and billed
trans-unit.target: **Subscription**: If you have more than one subscription, select the one on which the machine will be created and billed

trans-unit.source: **Resource Group**: You can create a new one or use an existing group
trans-unit.target: **Resource Group**: You can create a new one or use an existing group

trans-unit.source: **Location**: Select the data center that is most appropriate.
trans-unit.target: **Location**: Select the data center that is most appropriate.

trans-unit.source: Usually it is the data center that has most of your data or is closest to your physical location for fastest network access
trans-unit.target: Usually it is the data center that has most of your data or is closest to your physical location for fastest network access

trans-unit.source: **b. Size**:
trans-unit.target: **b. Size**:

trans-unit.source: Select one of the server types that meets your functional requirement and cost constraints.
trans-unit.target: Select one of the server types that meets your functional requirement and cost constraints.

trans-unit.source: You can get more choices of VM sizes by selecting “View All”
trans-unit.target: You can get more choices of VM sizes by selecting “View All”

trans-unit.source: **c. Settings**
trans-unit.target: **c. Settings**

trans-unit.source: **Disk Type**: Choose Premium if you prefer a solid state drive (SSD), else choose “Standard”.
trans-unit.target: **Disk Type**: Choose Premium if you prefer a solid state drive (SSD), else choose “Standard”.

trans-unit.source: **Storage Account**: You can create a new Azure storage account in your subscription or use an existing one in the same *Location* that was chosen on the Basics step of the wizard.
trans-unit.target: **Storage Account**: You can create a new Azure storage account in your subscription or use an existing one in the same *Location* that was chosen on the Basics step of the wizard.

trans-unit.source: **Other parameters**: In most cases you will just use the default values.
trans-unit.target: **Other parameters**: In most cases you will just use the default values.

trans-unit.source: You can hover over the informational link for help on the specific fields in case you want to consider the use of non-default values.
trans-unit.target: You can hover over the informational link for help on the specific fields in case you want to consider the use of non-default values.

trans-unit.source: **d. Summary**:
trans-unit.target: **d. Summary**:

trans-unit.source: Verify that all information you entered is correct.
trans-unit.target: Verify that all information you entered is correct.

trans-unit.source: **e. Buy**:
trans-unit.target: **e. Buy**:

trans-unit.source: Click on **Buy** to start the provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Buy** to start the provisioning.

trans-unit.source: A link is provided to the terms of the transaction.
trans-unit.target: A link is provided to the terms of the transaction.

trans-unit.source: The VM does not have any additional charges beyond the compute for the server size you chose in the **Size** step.
trans-unit.target: The VM does not have any additional charges beyond the compute for the server size you chose in the **Size** step.

trans-unit.source: The provisioning should take about 10-20 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The provisioning should take about 10-20 minutes.

trans-unit.source: The status of the provisioning is displayed on the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The status of the provisioning is displayed on the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: How to access the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: How to access the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Once the VM is created you can login to it using remote desktop with the Admin account credentials you created in the Basics section of step 4.
trans-unit.target: Once the VM is created you can login to it using remote desktop with the Admin account credentials you created in the Basics section of step 4.

trans-unit.source: Once your VM is created and provisioned, you are ready to start using the tools that are installed and configured on it.
trans-unit.target: Once your VM is created and provisioned, you are ready to start using the tools that are installed and configured on it.

trans-unit.source: There are start menu tiles and desktop icons for many of the tools.
trans-unit.target: There are start menu tiles and desktop icons for many of the tools.

trans-unit.source: How to create a strong password on the Jupyter notebook server
trans-unit.target: How to create a strong password on the Jupyter notebook server

trans-unit.source: Run the following command from the a command prompt on the Data Science Virtual Machine to create your own strong password for the Jupyter notebook server installed on the machine.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command from the a command prompt on the Data Science Virtual Machine to create your own strong password for the Jupyter notebook server installed on the machine.

trans-unit.source: Choose a strong password when prompted.
trans-unit.target: Choose a strong password when prompted.

trans-unit.source: You will see the password hash in the format "sha1:xxxxxx" in the output.
trans-unit.target: You will see the password hash in the format "sha1:xxxxxx" in the output.

trans-unit.source: Copy this password hash and replace the existing hash that is in your notebook config file located at: **C:\ProgramData\jupyter\jupyter_notebook_config.py** with a parameter name ***c.NotebookApp.password***.
trans-unit.target: Copy this password hash and replace the existing hash that is in your notebook config file located at: **C:\ProgramData\jupyter\jupyter_notebook_config.py** with a parameter name ***c.NotebookApp.password***.

trans-unit.source: You should only replace the existing hash value that is within the quotes.
trans-unit.target: You should only replace the existing hash value that is within the quotes.

trans-unit.source: The quotes and the ***sha1:*** prefix for the parameter value need to be retained.
trans-unit.target: The quotes and the ***sha1:*** prefix for the parameter value need to be retained.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you need to stop and restart the Ipython server which is running on the VM as a windows scheduled task called "Start_IPython_Notebook".
trans-unit.target: Finally, you need to stop and restart the Ipython server which is running on the VM as a windows scheduled task called "Start_IPython_Notebook".

trans-unit.source: If your new password is not accepted after restarting this task, try restarting the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If your new password is not accepted after restarting this task, try restarting the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Tools installed on the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Tools installed on the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Microsoft R Server Developer Edition
trans-unit.target: Microsoft R Server Developer Edition

trans-unit.source: If you wish to use R for your analytics, the VM has Microsoft R Server Developer edition installed.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to use R for your analytics, the VM has Microsoft R Server Developer edition installed.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft R Server is a broadly deployable enterprise-class analytics platform based on R that is supported, scalable and secure.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft R Server is a broadly deployable enterprise-class analytics platform based on R that is supported, scalable and secure.

trans-unit.source: Supporting a variety of big data statistics, predictive modeling and machine learning capabilities, R Server supports the full range of analytics – exploration, analysis, visualization and modeling.
trans-unit.target: Supporting a variety of big data statistics, predictive modeling and machine learning capabilities, R Server supports the full range of analytics – exploration, analysis, visualization and modeling.

trans-unit.source: By using and extending open source R, Microsoft R Server is fully compatible with R scripts, functions and CRAN packages, to analyze data at enterprise scale.
trans-unit.target: By using and extending open source R, Microsoft R Server is fully compatible with R scripts, functions and CRAN packages, to analyze data at enterprise scale.

trans-unit.source: It also addresses the in-memory limitations of Open Source R by adding parallel and chunked processing of data in Microsoft R Server, enabling users to run analytics on data much bigger than what fits in main memory.
trans-unit.target: It also addresses the in-memory limitations of Open Source R by adding parallel and chunked processing of data in Microsoft R Server, enabling users to run analytics on data much bigger than what fits in main memory.

trans-unit.source: An IDE for R is also packaged in the VM that can be accessed by clicking the icon "Revolution R Enterprise 8.0" on the start menu or the desktop.
trans-unit.target: An IDE for R is also packaged in the VM that can be accessed by clicking the icon "Revolution R Enterprise 8.0" on the start menu or the desktop.

trans-unit.source: You are free to download and use other IDEs as well such as [RStudio](http://www.rstudio.com).
trans-unit.target: You are free to download and use other IDEs as well such as [RStudio](http://www.rstudio.com).

trans-unit.source: Python
trans-unit.target: Python

trans-unit.source: For development using Python, Anaconda Python distribution 2.7 and 3.5 has been installed.
trans-unit.target: For development using Python, Anaconda Python distribution 2.7 and 3.5 has been installed.

trans-unit.source: This distribution contains the base Python along with about 300 of the most popular math, engineering and data analytics packages.
trans-unit.target: This distribution contains the base Python along with about 300 of the most popular math, engineering and data analytics packages.

trans-unit.source: You can use Python Tools for Visual Studio (PTVS) that is installed within the Visual Studio 2015 Community edition or one of the IDEs bundled with Anaconda like IDLE or Spyder.
trans-unit.target: You can use Python Tools for Visual Studio (PTVS) that is installed within the Visual Studio 2015 Community edition or one of the IDEs bundled with Anaconda like IDLE or Spyder.

trans-unit.source: You can launch one of these by searching on the search bar (**Win** + **S** key).
trans-unit.target: You can launch one of these by searching on the search bar (**Win** + **S** key).

trans-unit.source: **Note**: In order to point the Python Tools for Visual Studio at Anaconda Python 2.7 and 3.5, you need to go create custom environments for each version by navigating to Tools -> Python Tools -> Python Environments and then clicking "+ Custom" in the Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition and setting the environment paths.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: In order to point the Python Tools for Visual Studio at Anaconda Python 2.7 and 3.5, you need to go create custom environments for each version by navigating to Tools -> Python Tools -> Python Environments and then clicking "+ Custom" in the Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition and setting the environment paths.

trans-unit.source: Anaconda Python 2.7 is installed under C:\Anaconda and Anaconda Python 3.5 is installed under c:\Anaconda\envs\py35.
trans-unit.target: Anaconda Python 2.7 is installed under C:\Anaconda and Anaconda Python 3.5 is installed under c:\Anaconda\envs\py35.

trans-unit.source: See [PTVS documentation](https://github.com/Microsoft/PTVS/wiki/Selecting-and-Installing-Python-Interpreters#hey-i-already-have-an-interpreter-on-my-machine-but-ptvs-doesnt-seem-to-know-about-it) for detailed steps.
trans-unit.target: See [PTVS documentation](https://github.com/Microsoft/PTVS/wiki/Selecting-and-Installing-Python-Interpreters#hey-i-already-have-an-interpreter-on-my-machine-but-ptvs-doesnt-seem-to-know-about-it) for detailed steps.

trans-unit.source: Jupyter Notebook
trans-unit.target: Jupyter Notebook

trans-unit.source: Anaconda distribution also comes with an Jupyter notebook, an environment to share code and analysis.
trans-unit.target: Anaconda distribution also comes with an Jupyter notebook, an environment to share code and analysis.

trans-unit.source: An Jupyter notebook server has been pre-configured with Python 2, Python 3 and R kernels.
trans-unit.target: An Jupyter notebook server has been pre-configured with Python 2, Python 3 and R kernels.

trans-unit.source: There is a desktop icon named "Jupyter Notebook to launch the browser to access the Notebook server.
trans-unit.target: There is a desktop icon named "Jupyter Notebook to launch the browser to access the Notebook server.

trans-unit.source: If you are on the VM via remote desktop you can also visit [https://localhost:9999/](https://localhost:9999/) to access the Jupyter notebook server (Note: Continue if you get any certificate warnings.).
trans-unit.target: If you are on the VM via remote desktop you can also visit [https://localhost:9999/](https://localhost:9999/) to access the Jupyter notebook server (Note: Continue if you get any certificate warnings.).

trans-unit.source: We have packaged sample notebooks - one in Python and one in R. You can see the link to the samples on the notebook home page after you authenticate to the Jupyter notebook using the password you created in earlier step.
trans-unit.target: We have packaged sample notebooks - one in Python and one in R. You can see the link to the samples on the notebook home page after you authenticate to the Jupyter notebook using the password you created in earlier step.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 Community edition
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 Community edition

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Community edition installed on the VM.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Community edition installed on the VM.

trans-unit.source: It is a free version of the popular IDE from Microsoft that you can use for evaluation purposes and for very small teams.
trans-unit.target: It is a free version of the popular IDE from Microsoft that you can use for evaluation purposes and for very small teams.

trans-unit.source: You can check out the licensing terms [here](https://www.visualstudio.com/support/legal/mt171547).
trans-unit.target: You can check out the licensing terms [here](https://www.visualstudio.com/support/legal/mt171547).

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio by double clicking the desktop icon or the **Start** menu.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio by double clicking the desktop icon or the **Start** menu.

trans-unit.source: You can also search for programs with **Win** + **S** and entering “Visual Studio”.
trans-unit.target: You can also search for programs with **Win** + **S** and entering “Visual Studio”.

trans-unit.source: Once there you can create projects in languages like C#, Python.
trans-unit.target: Once there you can create projects in languages like C#, Python.

trans-unit.source: You will also find plugins installed that make it convenient to work with Azure services like Azure Data Catalog, Azure HDInsight (Hadoop, Spark) and Azure Data Lake.
trans-unit.target: You will also find plugins installed that make it convenient to work with Azure services like Azure Data Catalog, Azure HDInsight (Hadoop, Spark) and Azure Data Lake.

trans-unit.source: Note: You may get a message stating that your evaluation period has expired.
trans-unit.target: Note: You may get a message stating that your evaluation period has expired.

trans-unit.source: You can enter a Microsoft Account credentials or create one and enter them to get access to the Visual Studio Community Edition.
trans-unit.target: You can enter a Microsoft Account credentials or create one and enter them to get access to the Visual Studio Community Edition.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Express
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Express

trans-unit.source: A limited version of SQL Server is also packaged with Visual Studio Community edition.
trans-unit.target: A limited version of SQL Server is also packaged with Visual Studio Community edition.

trans-unit.source: You can access the SQL server by launching **SQL Server Management Studio**.
trans-unit.target: You can access the SQL server by launching **SQL Server Management Studio**.

trans-unit.source: Your VM name will be populated as the Server Name.
trans-unit.target: Your VM name will be populated as the Server Name.

trans-unit.source: Use Windows Authentication when logged in as the admin on Windows.
trans-unit.target: Use Windows Authentication when logged in as the admin on Windows.

trans-unit.source: Once you are in SQL Server Management Studio you can create other users, create databases, import data, and run SQL queries.
trans-unit.target: Once you are in SQL Server Management Studio you can create other users, create databases, import data, and run SQL queries.

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Several Azure tools are installed on the VM:
trans-unit.target: Several Azure tools are installed on the VM:

trans-unit.source: There is a desktop shortcut to access the Azure SDK documentation.
trans-unit.target: There is a desktop shortcut to access the Azure SDK documentation.

trans-unit.source: **AzCopy** used to move data in and out of your Microsoft Azure Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: **AzCopy** used to move data in and out of your Microsoft Azure Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage Explorer** used to browse through the objects that you have stored within your Azure Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage Explorer** used to browse through the objects that you have stored within your Azure Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Azure Powershell** - a tool used to administer your Azure resources in the Powershell scripting language is also installed on your VM.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Azure Powershell** - a tool used to administer your Azure resources in the Powershell scripting language is also installed on your VM.

trans-unit.source: Power BI
trans-unit.target: Power BI

trans-unit.source: To help you build dashboards and great visualizations, the **Power BI Desktop** has been installed.
trans-unit.target: To help you build dashboards and great visualizations, the **Power BI Desktop** has been installed.

trans-unit.source: Use this tool to pull data from different sources, to author your dashboards and reports, and to publish them to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Use this tool to pull data from different sources, to author your dashboards and reports, and to publish them to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For information, see the [Power BI](http://powerbi.microsoft.com) site.
trans-unit.target: For information, see the [Power BI](http://powerbi.microsoft.com) site.

trans-unit.source: Note: You will need an Office 365 account to access Power BI.
trans-unit.target: Note: You will need an Office 365 account to access Power BI.

trans-unit.source: Additional Microsoft development tools
trans-unit.target: Additional Microsoft development tools

trans-unit.source: The [**Microsoft Web Platform Installer**](https://www.microsoft.com/web/downloads/platform.aspx) can be used to discover and download other Microsoft development tools.
trans-unit.target: The [**Microsoft Web Platform Installer**](https://www.microsoft.com/web/downloads/platform.aspx) can be used to discover and download other Microsoft development tools.

trans-unit.source: There is also a shortcut to the tool provided on the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine desktop.
trans-unit.target: There is also a shortcut to the tool provided on the Microsoft Data Science Virtual Machine desktop.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Here are some next steps to continue your learning and exploration.
trans-unit.target: Here are some next steps to continue your learning and exploration.

trans-unit.source: Explore the various data science tools on the data science VM by clicking on the start menu and checking out the tools listed on the menu
trans-unit.target: Explore the various data science tools on the data science VM by clicking on the start menu and checking out the tools listed on the menu

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **C:\Program Files\Microsoft\MRO-for-RRE\8.0\R-3.2.2\library\RevoScaleR\demoScripts** for samples using the RevoScaleR library in R that supports data analytics at enterprise scale.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **C:\Program Files\Microsoft\MRO-for-RRE\8.0\R-3.2.2\library\RevoScaleR\demoScripts** for samples using the RevoScaleR library in R that supports data analytics at enterprise scale.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to build end to end analytical solutions systematically using the [Data Science Process](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/cortana-analytics-process/)
trans-unit.target: Learn how to build end to end analytical solutions systematically using the [Data Science Process](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/cortana-analytics-process/)

trans-unit.source: Visit the [Cortana Analytics Gallery](http://gallery.cortanaanalytics.com) for machine learning and data analytics samples using the Cortana Analytics Suite.
trans-unit.target: Visit the [Cortana Analytics Gallery](http://gallery.cortanaanalytics.com) for machine learning and data analytics samples using the Cortana Analytics Suite.

trans-unit.source: We have also provided an icon on the Start menu and desktop on the virtual machine for easy access
trans-unit.target: We have also provided an icon on the Start menu and desktop on the virtual machine for easy access
